articles.title: Australia battles Delta Covid surge as Europe eases restrictions - eNCA
articles.description: Sydney's normally bustling harbourside centre was nearly deserted after its lockdown took effect, with officials bracing the public for a spiralling crisis.
articles.content:
"We do need to brace ourselves for a potentially large number of cases in the following days," said Gladys Berejiklian, the Premier of New South Wales state.

articles.title: 'Space is for everyone': Europe's space agency to hire first disabled astronaut - The Straits Times

articles.title: UEFA rule change leaves Liverpool at a disadvantage, and Jürgen Klopp won't be happy - Liverpool.com
articles.description: The away goal rule has been axed by the European governing body after 56 years, and the resulting change will mean Liverpool and other teams in European competition face the potential of more game time.
